review.title: Okay hotel close to the highway and to the shops
review.reviewText:
The exterior of the of Four Points by Sheraton San Francisco Bay Bridge looks great.  Parking is plentiful.  The hotel is very close to the highway and it is across the street from a number of diners as well as a shopping plaza.  The lobby looks nice and the staff is very attentive.  That is where it ends unfortunately for me.

We booked for a two double bed room and the staff were very helpful with the check-in process.  The room is adequately clean.  However, the fixtures and lighting of the room is deplorable.  The hotel lobby and the rest of the hotel looks like it was designed by two separate teams.  Once you exit the elevators on to your floor, you feel as if you were transported to the 1970's with bone white colored walls.  They use cool light CFL bulbs in the room which makes the room unnecessarily dreary amber and dull.  Unless you get direct light into your room, the room will look as if you are stuck in a dark and depressing place with brown carpet.  Come on, bone white walls and brown carpet?   

My room is situated on the third floor which has a vending machine as well as an ice machine.  I would not go near the ice machine as it looks dingy and has not been cleaned for a very long time.  You can actually see black specks which can be mildew.  I cannot believe that after paying over $200 a night for a room, i ended up checking into something that makes a half star motel look regal.  

The only saving grace of this hotel is the staff which is wonderful.  Thank you
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel is close to the highway and to a shopping plaza.  There is free tea and coffee in the morning.  The staff is very attentive and very nice.
review.negativeRemarks:
1.  Please repaint the walls to another color other than bone white.  
2.  Change your CFL bulbs to daylight. 
3.  Clean the ice machine.
review.locationRemarks: There is a shopping plaza so you can handle your day to day needs.  There is a Trader Joe's as well as a Starbucks.  There are plenty of diners near.

review.title: Nice and clean but the beds no for two is small

review.title: great hotel stay

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText:
Good location, close to major highways, 5 minutes from SF Bay Bridge, and easy access to Oakland Airport. Next door to additional restaurants and shopping.
Hotel was undergoing some exterior updating but didn't really cause any guest inconvenience. Staff was great, room very clean. Tiny bathroom, a little dated but otherwise very comfortable.

Expected higher end comforts for the price.
No usb ports and few electrical outlets.

review.title: Very nice hotel right across the railway tracks.
review.reviewText: The hotel was only one block from the train station.  All you had to do was to cross the walking bridge over the tracks and the hotel was in plain view close by.  The inside was very clean and well presented and the staff was very helpful by describing the bus routes to San Francisco.

review.reviewText: House keeping seemed to be very slow.  Two days in a row, I was out of my room between 7:30 a.m. and 2:30 p.m. only to return to my room to find that it had not yet been serviced / made up by housekeeping.  One day I had to vacate my room so they could work on it at about 3:00 p.m.  The other day, I needed to use my room and couldn't vacate it in the mid / late afternoon so it was not serviced / made up at all.

review.title: Just Okay
review.reviewText: We stayed here for my son's graduation from Cal. The hotel staff was nice, and the front desk was decorated with Cal colors and balloons. There is a Trader Joe's right across the street which is really convenient. The rooms are very standard, no mini fridge, no HDTV. Our room smelled very musty, but there was a window so we were able to let fresh air in. The shower/toilet room was tiny and the shower wasn't very clean; the carpet needs to be replaced as well.  Overall, it was fine because we weren't there much, but for the price, we expected more. We won't stay here again even though we visit Berkeley often.
review.negativeRemarks: Upgrade the rooms!
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance to shops and restaurants, short drive to Berkeley.

review.title: Near Berkeley

I was traveling with my husband on a wheelchair so I ask for a handicap room, the room they gave me was incredibly small! The wheelchair could not go around the room and the bathroom was so small we hardly fit in , by the way we are slim people.

review.title: 15 minutes from UCBerkeley
review.reviewText: Nice, clean, updated & comfortable bed. Very nice bay & SF view. Friendly staff. Free parking!!! We had 2 double beds and the only negative was that the room was a bit cramped.

review.title: Overbooked hotel. Undertrained staff.
review.reviewText: I was given a room that was already occupied. The front desk agent nonchalantly told me that my room was the last room available and that they had to send me to another hotel five miles down the road. Not cool Expedia!

review.title: 4 Night Stay

The hotel staff is top notch friendly providing excellent customer service.
The beds and linens are extremely comfortable - even more then your average high end hotel.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Although we very comfortable in our room and it had a good location, the hotel has some faults.  Only one elevator was working the entire 3 nights we stayed. The water pressure was so low in our sink that it was very difficult to wash up or brush your teeth.  There also were not enough electric outlets for us to plug in our our phones & tablets.

review.title: Overnight stay
review.reviewText: My daughter had just had surgery and we needed to stay nearby overnight. She said she loved how quiet it was and how comfortable the bed was, which she had not expected. I liked the room too, except I thought the bathroom was too small. The next morning they told me that if I had asked for an upgrade by making reservations at the hotel, I could have gotten a larger bath. Also, I did not get my usual senior citizen discount which I get almost everywhere.
review.positiveRemarks: Very quiet room. Comfortable beds. Easy access and good parking close to the entrance.
review.negativeRemarks: Larger bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Did not see much, but liked Trader Joes nearby.

review.title: Comfortable Staycation
review.reviewText: It was great Valentine's weekend. Vert relaxing and comforting. Staff was extremely sweet. Only problem was our phone didn't work.

review.title: Great hotel close to San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great staff, comfy beds, excellent service and affordable!! Only complaint is the bathrooms are too small.

review.title: Close to hospital

Was where we needed to be.  Front desk people couldn't have been better.  Friendly and very helpful and accomodating.
Since we weren't there on a pleasure trip chose cheapest room we could get.  The only problem was the bathroom was so small you could hardly get in and close the door.
review.locationRemarks: free shuttle across the street that would take you to BART station.

review.title: Had to stay
review.reviewText: Place was not bad only complaint was TV reception. Why not give ur guest at least a TV channel that is clear. I checked out and went to Sac the next day stayed at Hilton garden inn    in natomas although they were remodeling my room was very nice and the TV was clear. It petty I know but if you are alone with nothing to do but watch the TV it can matter. I will say the view is SD made up for any annoyance but what would u do if u where not on top floor or facing the bay.

review.title: Mediocre experience
review.reviewText: You can tell this was an old hotel that they bought and spent as little money as possible to seem like a "hip" hotel. One of the elevators was out of service which is not that unusual but possibly an indication of old equipment or poor maintenance. When you get on the elevator the floor cracks and creeks. Then around 1am my AC unit was making a sound like something stuck in the fan, tap tap tap tap, quickly. The noise grew louder and I was not able to sleep. I got up an noticed a smell of electrical components burning and realized it was the sound of electricity arcing. I called down stairs and they offered another room. By the time the person from maintenance arrived there were sparks coming from it and the smell of electrical fire was much stronger. I gather all my belongings, 2am at this time and was "upgraded" to the same exact room one floor up. They took care of me though. Since my room almost had a fire in the middle of the night which could have seriously injured or worse, they slid a voucher under my door for one free breakfast item. Other than all that staff was friendly and I had no complaints.

review.title: Close to what we were doing in San Fran
review.reviewText: Clean and nice hotel within the distance appropriate to our needs.

review.title: My Two Days Stay
review.reviewText: The staffs are very friendly.  Hotel is kind of old and room have smell.  Also, I found a water used water bottle on the floor by the bed.  The restroom are extremely small, can't even make any turn in the restroom.  Lastly,  I can't even open and/or shut the restroom door.  Once the toilet set is pulled down, the door get stuck.
review.negativeRemarks: The toilet door get on my nerves.  Please fix.
review.locationRemarks: I visit my family here.

review.reviewText:
Nice hotel will be recommended .,
Nice time in San Francisco

review.title: Nice staff, convenient location, very comfy bed
review.reviewText:
I liked the location, the staff was very efficient and kind on my check-in and the bed was very comfy.  I didn't spend much time in the room since I had a VERY early flight, but the staff made everything convenient for me and they were very professional and polite, focused on the customers and not interacting with one another.  
The hotel decor seemed out of date in the lobby and in the rooms, but the accommodations were comfortable and everything was clean and serviceable.  I would stay again and I would recommend it.  I am a die-hard Marriott person, and I hope that this property will survive the merger, as the experience here was much better than the one I had at the Marriott Courtyard down the street earlier in the week.

review.title: Go elsewhere.
review.reviewText: Abut the only thing positive I can share is that the location of this hotel is handy. I checked in, and my hotel key only worked twice out of two days stay there. I'm not kidding. something was up with the jets that they had ordered. I was put in a room that adjoined another, and it was like I was staying with those strangers- i.e. Walls paper thin. Unfortunately, they were night owls. Bathroom was dirty. For $330 for 2 nights, it was definitely NOT worth the money. Look for other deals out there.

review.title: Nice hotel and very comfy beds
review.reviewText: The hotel room it's self was very nice and clean they hallways look a little outdated though. The staff was very nice. It's close to many things. Close to the beach and close to restaurants.

review.title: nice hotel close to beach
review.reviewText: It is a Quite and clean and comfortable hotel with very nice staffs.

review.title: overnight business trip
review.reviewText: the new updates were very much appreciated.  the desk space in the room is very large.  parking and wi-fi is free.  lounge and restaurant staff are very accommodating and friendly.  walk to shopping and nearby restaurants.
review.negativeRemarks: television reception and more channels
review.locationRemarks: excellent rate for the location.  lots of things to walk to after a long day of work.

review.reviewText: Great young, eager staff. Easy, ample parking. Safe neighborhood.

We stayed at your hotel while attending a wedding on Treasure Island. Freeway access was convenient for attending the wedding and for driving into San Francisco the next day. The front desk clerk gave us good suggestions for parking while visiting San Francisco. The room was very quiet even though it was so close to the freeway and railway.

review.title: What free WiFi?
review.reviewText: The hotel is conveniently located, our room was on the small side, but very clean.  The staff was very helpful and friendly.   Our only negative was the fact that the free WiFi didn't work.  We were on the top (7th) floor and it's possible their main router was too far away.  Be that as it may, I am not looking forward to seeing how much of my data plan I had to use this month because I couldn't access the WiFi on my phone.  (Fortunately, there was a cable to hardwire my husband's computer - though the connection was extremely slow.)  We wish the room/desk had more outlets available for charging our phones, tablet and computer.

review.title: Great room; comfy beds
review.reviewText:
Great room accommodation excellent
Would stay again

review.title: Like a closet with a full size bed
review.reviewText: Check in was cold and impersonal. Room was very small, I guess the Expedia mystery price means you get what you pay for. There was gross dust in the bathroom door latch. The bed was comfortable and clean but not Queen or King. We were given a room next to the elevator and ice machine. Asked for a bay view and were told curtly that 'We don't have one' The location is great. The Wi-Fi was terrible yet free. Check out was 3 words with no question as to 'was everything ok'? Would not stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Too much to list.
review.locationRemarks: Trader Vic's restaurant.

review.title: 1:20 am flashing lights and alarm in my room.
review.reviewText:
Stayed here for work.  I was alone and awakened at 1:20 am by flashing lights in my room and an alarm sounding loudly.  Terrifying.  Opened the door to see if it was a fire alarm or bomb threat.  All was silent; no smoke.  Noise and light stopped after a minute or two and I went back to sleep, still a bit shaken.  At 1;40 it goes off again.  Now I'm really upset.

I call the desk and ask what is going on. Woman says she has no idea; will send up someone from Maintenance.  Guy comes in a few minutes.  Alarm had stopped again.  He takes out a device plugged in to the wall, which I thought might have been a carbon monoxide alarm (the only thing I could think that might have caused the alarm) and says sometimes its this.  I asked what it was and he had no idea.  That was the end of my sleep for the next couple of hours.  

Next morning, I talk to the desk and they inform me that I was in a handicap room and that there was a button on the outside of the room someone could push to wake a blind or deaf person in an emergency.  someone must have pushed it TWICE.  Why didn't they tell me that beforehand??? Answer: Sorry!!!  That's it??

I go to breakfast fuming.  I was told at check-in it was included in the ridiculously high price.  Get there and told no I needed a voucher for a free breakfast.  Go back to desk to complain again and I get sorry.  We'll comp you breakfast.  (Which was not worth the fuss).  
  
They should have comped me the room.
review.positiveRemarks: The folks who worked in the breakfast room were lovely.
review.negativeRemarks: Training of front desk staff.  Warning someone their room has this alarm and telling them how to turn it off if need be.

review.title: Sheraton review
review.reviewText:
1. Shower soap: The brand of liquid shower soap used has a strong musk scent. Suggest the hotel use something closer to no scent.
2. Air conditioner: Since the rooms do not have centralized air, the guests sleeping closest to the wall unit (pull-out couch and double bed) had cold air blowing on them, which was very uncomfortable. Centralized air conditioning would have been much more comfortable. 
These two issues would give us great pause in returning to this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks:
Hotel staff was very professional and helpful.
Also liked the option of saving water by opting out of having our room cleaned during our stay.
review.negativeRemarks: See comments above.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location. Amenities nearby.

review.title: Decent Hotel for the Money
review.reviewText: This was a decent hotel. I liked that the room had a microwave, fridge, and coffee maker. The bed was clean and comfortable and the balcony was a nice addition. And, free morning coffee in the lobby was very nice too! The hotel is conveniently located near some decent shopping and the Emery-go-round is a free shuttle that takes you to additional shopping, the Bart (train station), and more. This all made the hotel very convenient. The only drawback was some major street construction that made going in and out of the hotel a pain - but both car and foot. This is not the hotel's fault, of course. It seems the city of Emeryville decided it was a good idea to rip up the entire sidewalk around this hotel and leave pedestrians nowhere to walk.

review.title: Front staff was outstanding
review.reviewText: Free bottled water everyday, warm cookies at night and a clean room

review.title: Chi Town-
review.reviewText: The staff was wonderful from the time checked in to the time we checked out. I want to say thank you to Laura, who made wonderful drinks and food. Greg, who was creative and allowed us to try new drinks. Christie and Xtochi, who made are room stay  very nice even though our remote didn't work. They gave us complimentary drinks. Keke who also gave is complimentary breakfast which was really good. Victor, also came to listen to our suggestions and praise reports of the staff. I can't forget the man who helped move our luggage 3 times until we got our room right. Thank you to everyone!  I'll be back!

review.title: Nice hotel, rude staff, lacks common amenities
review.reviewText:
Tried reviewing this before, but apparently Sheraton has Expedia on payroll and won't let a bad review go through. I doubt this will get approved, but we'll see. This is my last attempt at reviewing this hotel.

The rooms are nice, small, but have nice finishings. Shower head is adjustable in height, but will spray you in the eyes if you are taller than 5'9", even at its tallest seeing. 
The in room internet is a joke, ridiculously slow, better off using your data on your phone.
No in room fridge or microwave, features that you find in even cheap, cheap motels. Should be standard, but they want to force you into using their expensive room service. They do have a microwave for use, in the lobby, it's supposed the be used for the convenience foods you can buy at the front desk for a 500% markup, but if you're sneaky, you can heat up last night's pizza a little before you get chased away.

The employees are very rude and do not care if you were a paying customer or a beggar trying to crash in their lobby, they treat you both like the latter. 

We made one simple request, an early checj in, when making the reservation, called to confirm it the day before, and were told tough luck when we got there. Saying that they don't do them and to keep checking back at x time. Checked back and the staff was annoyed we actually did before sending us away with another time to check back. Repeat this over and over.

Hotel is good, but staff is horrible. I would recommend a sleazy 8 instead.
It was ok could be better my view wast not that good I got a view of train in from of me and some homeless not a lot of restaurants near there

review.title: Everything you might need is close and with a view
review.reviewText: We were down for a surgery for my wife so comfort was key for her and with a teenage boy everything else was key. The beds are incredibly comfortable, the room was clean and quiet. Across the street there is a strip mall where my son got some great deals on early school clothes. The pool and hot tub was a great way to relax at night especially since it seemed we were the only ones that used them while we stayed there for 4 days. I will be staying here in the future for our next follow up appts in SF. This hotel is about an easy 30 minute drive to SF Piers, CPMC or most anything else near them. No reason to pay so much more for so much less! I love the staff here too!!!
review.positiveRemarks: PRICE! COMFORT! CLEANLINESS! Plus, the friendly staff was very knowledgeable about great places to see and eat at.
review.negativeRemarks: They are re-doing the sidewalks in the area so it would have been nice to know that before arriving but once in the room it was very quiet.
review.locationRemarks: Strip mall, restaurant, gas station just across the street and easy access to the freeway

review.title: It was as expected
review.reviewText:
location was clean , room was small but clean
As expected

review.title: Great location close to the movies and good food
review.reviewText: I had a great stay at this hotel. Facilities were clean and the staff was great. The even had free bbq and beer as well as free cookies. I would definitely stay here again.
Set up is a bit awkward but overall a pleasant experience
Staff was nice but hotel needs a serious overhaul. Rugs, bathroom, elevator, rooms, cleaning service, etc.

review.title: Mrs.
review.reviewText: Very happy about the hotel. The afternoon cookies  were really a treat. Will definitely  recommend to friends and family.

review.title: Hotel was ok.   Walking distance to shopping ctr.
review.reviewText: This was a lower budget Sheraton.  Parking was easy.   The staff should have been more knowledgeable about the area and places to see.
Easy on and off freeway, walking distance to shopping and theatre. Great place!

review.title: Great location. Easy access to SF.
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Close to shopping and food. Easy access to BART.

review.title: I thought Sheraton hotels were nicer
review.reviewText: This hotel is okay. Just okay. It looks like it was remodeled to bring it up to date, but the tiredness of the property is obvious. The bathroom and the carpet is particularly dated and seems like it came right out of a Motel 6. The room was a bit cramped and could have used a few power outlets to charge phone/ipad/laptop. I only found 1 outlet on a lamp and then 1 outlet in the bathroom. The bed is moderately comfortable and I have no complaints about that. The overall cleanliness is good. There are not a lot of hotel options in this area of Emeryville (East Bay), so if you just need a place to stay, this hotel works fine and is 'serviceable' and it's easy to get to because it's right off the freeway. If you're looking for something nice (4 star or above), I would probably look elsewhere. This hotel is 3-star at best.
review.negativeRemarks: update the bathrooms and carpet. the water constrictor in the bathroom sink resulted in water flowing a little more than a trickle.
review.locationRemarks: location is good if you're looking to stay in Emeryville. it is not walking distance from a BART station

review.title: The carpets are all need replacing.
review.reviewText:
The carpets are all need replacing. 

The staff are great and it is very close to Bay Street shops.

review.title: Nice hotel close to beach
review.reviewText: Good condition, nice staffs, and close to the beach.

review.title: Over booked
review.reviewText: Booked this room plenty in advance and got a call just before checking in that it was over booked and we had to find a new hotel

review.title: Seemed like a good idea at the time
review.reviewText: I was surprised by the small bathroom, short shower-head, not-included continental breakfast and difficult to use TV. I felt cramped most of the time, and I'm an average sized person.
review.positiveRemarks: It's location to where I needed to be.
review.negativeRemarks: Update amenities would be the first.
review.locationRemarks: There's plenty to do nearby - short walk to a store area for shopping or fast food restaurants or even a small diner.

review.title: Good location

Very convenient.  Great view of the bay bridge and the bay.  Pleasant staff and clean rooms.  Baked cookies in the afternoon.  Worked well for us.
review.locationRemarks: Right off the freeway.  Next to a Black Bear restaurant and across the street is a Denny's.  Gas station, Ross, Marshall's, Trader Joes across the st.

review.title: Worked for me
review.reviewText: This place had very friendly staff. They are more than willing to accommodate your needs. I only stayed one night. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The room felt cramped like a small room with too much furniture. The bathroom was clean but felt like you were in a closet. Very easy on and off freeway access and close to shopping. Black bear diner is right next door. Fit my needs for one night.

review.title: Stinky, wet room
review.reviewText: Room was nice, however the floor was soaked. I tried to dry it myself, but there was nothing I could do. After leaving for a couple hours and coming back the room smelt horrible. Asked the staff and was given a small air freshener that didn't work. Told front lobby again and he said sorry to hear that and walked away. After that I will not be going back.

review.title: Very convenient, very comfortable
review.reviewText: Stayed here recently while visiting family and friends in the Bay area, and this was a great, comfortable location for our stay.  The staff was uniformly lovely and helpful, always cheerful and pleasant. The rooms were well appointed, and comfortable, and despite being right on the highway, there wasn't much noise from the traffic. Easy walking distance to Starbucks, and several good places to eat.
review.locationRemarks: Highly recommend Doyle Street Cafe for breakfast/brunch and Honor bar and kitchen for dinner/drinks.

We went for a king with pullout sofa bed (our son drew the short straw).  Massive room and a really comfortable bed.  The bathroom was, however, VERY cramped and had to navigate.  You quite literally had to step around the toilet to get to the shower.
review.negativeRemarks: Check in
review.locationRemarks: Great location near shops and restaurants and yet still relatively close to Cal.

review.title: Bad hotel
review.reviewText: We arrived early and they told us the earliest we would be aloud to check in with the room ready would be 7am so we did and they said oh Its not ready not till 10am. So we waited 4 more hours for them to tell us the room is still not ready. Finally at about 12 they allowed us into a room that was way too small. We asked for a roll away due to only have a full size bed for 4 people but the roll away did not even fit. So we had to change room to a delux King room with a pull out couch but had to wait till 3pm for that room. They were so unready for guest to arrive.
Great location, excellent staff, affordable rates, and free parking.

review.title: Always a good stay
review.reviewText: The staff and location of the hotel is great.  Friendly and located in a convenient area for shopping.  10 minutes to Berkeley and right in Emeryville.  Will stay again.

review.title: Great location, friendly staff
review.reviewText: Wonderful location, walking distance to shops, restaurants.  Free shuttle to BART.  Helpful staff. Lobby is a bit small, though.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Just a mile and a half away from the local Bart train station and 5 minutes from one of the marinas, the hotel allows for brief escapes in a business environment. If you are a runner, an 8 miles run will take you through two marinas, half will allow for great views over the bay early morning and afternoon. People are great at the hotel, friendly and helpful, rooms are clean, spacious and after work you can enjoy a drink at the well fitted hotel bar.
review.positiveRemarks: The people in general, the bed
review.locationRemarks: Marina walks, several restaurants nearby

review.reviewText: I stayed for one night; however, it was a very pleasing experience the staff member who attended us was one to remember the women was very insightful and helpful since we were not from the area. Definitely a night to remember the room came with the use of the television which was a plus since I was tired from the long drive yet it was too early to go to sleep. Overall good hotel, the rooms maybe a little small however but does not take away from the comfort.
We had everything we needed. Comfortable. Quick check-in. Courteous staff.

review.title: My Trip To Emeryville
review.reviewText: I was welcomed at checkin and helped with my plans immediately. Loved that the location was so conviently by shopping,movies, and restartants. The bed was so confortable,I slept like a log. All staff was helpful and friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: not a thing
review.locationRemarks: Location was great, bayview mall was two blocks away.

review.title: Convenient location.
review.reviewText: Easy parking.  Friendly staff.  Easy check-in.  Comfortable room.  Simple internet connection.  Trains do rumbling pass in early morning but did not bother us.  Easy check-out.  We did not use any of the facilities.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is central to East Bay and convenient to shopping around that area.
review.locationRemarks: IKEA, Trader Joe, Bevmo, East Honk Kong Ocean restaurant, Emery Bay shopping center.

review.title: Like the fact it was close to shop..eat/shopping.
review.reviewText: Okay experience I thoujt the rooms could have been a tad bit bigger. Also, there was an annoying noise outside the window that woke us all up, not sure if it was a woodpecker or construction.

review.title: Nice hotel - convenient access to freeways
review.reviewText:
If you use Expedia as your hotel booking agent, you will not get a free breakfast.  Breakfast costs by the item .  "Free breakfast" is one item and it is a big one or 1 item on the ala carte menu .   The little cafe was handy for breakfast and I had all I needed.  Fruit, Bagel, coffee, milk, cereal, eggs in a variety of ways.   It also serves a light dinner which I really appreciated the day I was driving a lot.   Salad, hamburgers, soup are all on the dinner menu.

Bonus:  This hotel does NOT charge for parking!!

The room was comfortable, everything worked and there were plenty of outlets to plug  stuff in.  Even on Christmas Day the room was cleaned nicely and the bed made.  I did notice the carpet was a bit dirty but that's not unusual for a hotel. 

All employees great you with a smile and ask if there is anything they can do for you.  Nice place to stay.
review.positiveRemarks: No charge for parking!, Easy freeway access.  Emeryville's Bus service is FREE to BART.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient to freeways; major shopping in walking distance; Bus to BART gives you access to San Francisco with no hassles of parking.

review.title: Great hotel for the price.  Very friendly staff.
review.reviewText: Had a room with view.  Beds were very very comfortable and had small fridge and microwave...so convenient.  Would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Sink leaking, fridge broken omg!
review.reviewText: It was as bad as a motel 6 in the middle of no where.

review.title: Convenient but next to noisy road.
review.reviewText: Door too loose for my comfort.  Did not close automatically and shook.  Hallways a little dim.
review.negativeRemarks: Triple pane windows to reduce car noises.
review.locationRemarks: Gas and food close.

review.title: Great except parking.
review.reviewText: I had a great experience clean, friendly, safer than staying in Oakland and more roomy than San Francisco but I could not find parking anywhere. The security guard sent me to additional parking which was actually a strip of space under a bridge without lighting.

review.title: Lots of free add-ons, good location
review.reviewText: Free wi-fi, parking, bottled water, OK coffee in the lobby. Easy to get onto highways, especially 580 or Bay Bridge. Comfortable bed, walk to shopping on Bay Street.
review.positiveRemarks: For green travelers, hotel hands out a $5 voucher each day your linens don't need to be changed. Can be used at their bar or small cafe.
review.locationRemarks: Much to do in Berkeley, Oakland, etc.

review.title: Nice close to shops cinema and UC berkeley
review.reviewText: The front desk staff were very pleasant, courteous and helpful. Went above and beyond to look up my old Starwood preferred guest account information so I could get credit for my stay.

review.title: thank you.
review.reviewText: They allowed me to check in early and that was very important to me as I needed to get ready for a very important meeting.
review.positiveRemarks: They allowed me to check in early.

review.title: Dreamersluck777
review.reviewText: I loved this hotel smelled so good like nothing ever like it it's a smoke free building. The staff was great the rooms where nice and clean and hotel was close to outlets and restuarants u can enjoy not far from fisherman wharf only like 15 to 20 min. Overall I will defenitelty come back again :)
Pleasant- very comfortable beds and clean. Nice staff and breakfast food very good and timely room service

review.title: Friendly & helpful staff
review.reviewText:
The location is very conveniently located off the freeway but still quiet.  All of the staff were very friendly and helpful.  They made the stay very pleasant.  They seemed to go out of their way to ensure the quality of the service.
It's not a high quality facility but the staff make up for it.   If they remodel some it could be a higher rated hotel.
I would stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff know how to treat their guests.
review.negativeRemarks: The building could use some upgrading.

review.title: Bad start But they fixed the situation later
review.reviewText:
I arrived. They gave me a room. The madre was still inside cleaning the room. Then they gave me another room. TV, safebox, lampa, lights, nothing worked.

Finally they gave the final room Which was fine.

The hotel is Ok

I booked my reservation on expedia and my room was nothing like my booking. I booked a jr suite with sofa, patio etc...First thing was rhe plumbing was all backed up. While taking a shower the water did not go down the drain, the sink was the same way. Our air conditioner only went to 73 degrees. My all over experience was disappointing because i am a spg member and I have never stayed in a hotel of this character.  While checking out the receptionist informed me that the Emeryville location does not offer jr suites.
review.locationRemarks: I was attending my christmas party and i live in Tracy, Calif. so my husband and I didnt want to drive home after the party.

review.title: Handicap room
review.reviewText: They gave me to stay in the handicapped room which is not disclosed when I booked it, perhaps because I booked through Expedia? or is it because it's right by the elevator so the clean staffs can access and clean it quick, I don't know for sure, but the room carpet seems dirty, is very dark it's also hard to tell if it's clean.  Overall felt like 2-star motel.  This is definitely not Sheraton at all

review.title: Great location off the freeway
review.reviewText: Good location. Lots of shopping around within walking distance.
Overall good experience.  Hotel staff was excellent and friendly. I would come back if visiting the area. Nearby train tracks can be noisy though.

review.title: Room smelled
review.reviewText: Arrived very late on evening to what we were told was a sold out night. There was an awful, old food odor in our room. It was so bad I could not get to sleep. I would never go back !
review.negativeRemarks: housekeeping

review.title: Nice hotel in Emeryville
review.reviewText: Nice hotel in the middle of Emeryville. The hotel is close to the train tracks, so I sometimes heard trains moving during the night. We had to wait awhile for the elevator whenever going back to the first floor.

Found some makeup sponges under the blanket. Most likely the housekeeper made the bed nice but never changed the sheets. It was kinda of discussing to sleep in bed after someone else. Dirty carpet. Very nice location for me. Will defiantly stay there again

review.title: Reasonable quality, good location.
review.reviewText: the hotel lobby lobby, cafe and bar are very nice and modern. Rooms are a little dated and ac was either too cold or too warm, and it was only 74 degrees outside. Staff was very helpful and professional. The location was close to shopping and resturants.

review.title: They had to clean again before we entered
review.reviewText: Room smelled like smoke, and towels were dirty. Bathtub not cleaned in some time. At least the pillows were OK and clean sheets bout it

review.title: Too expensive for what you get.
review.reviewText: Found hotel ratings online. Beware... Some sites will rate hotel 4 stars... Some will rate 3 stars. That one star difference can be absolutely huge. I saw 4 star ratings... Booked online through Expedia.... About $230 a night. Expected luxury... Got blah. Just bland. Not nearly worth the money. No continental breakfast? Wow. Only myself to blame. Should have done more research.

review.title: Clean, great location and nice staff.
review.reviewText: No complaints. Staff was helpful and well mannered. Location was across the street from the train station. room was great.
review.negativeRemarks: nothing we noticed
review.locationRemarks: Across from Bay Street Shopping. Across from the Emeryville Amtrak Station. Near freeways.

review.title: Very nice experience
review.reviewText: Accommodations were clean, and well kept.  Staff was courteous, professional and helpful.  Location could be better, but I would stay here again.

review.title: Needs an update
review.reviewText: The rugs in our King room were really stained and worn, and it smelled strongly of room deodorizer covering up a funky smell.  I didn't find it to be good value for the cost.  On the positive side, the bed and pillows were nice and the room was large.

review.title: nice hotel close to train station
review.reviewText: stayed one night  everything was  fine very close to the train station
Someone should clean more thoroughly.  The carpets had clearly not been vacuumed in some time, or only in a very cursory manner, both in the room and in the halls.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness.

review.title: Perfect for short stay
review.reviewText:
Ideal for a quick stay - beds very comfortable.  only downside was how small the bathroom was.  
Huge bonus was that we stayed on a wednesday night and they did free beer and ribs for hotel guests!!!

review.title: Awesome staff!
review.reviewText: Every staff member we encountered was not only friendly but extremely helpful. We were very pleased.

review.title: Not what was expected for a Sheraton Hotel.
review.reviewText: Who wants a sink in their bedroom instead of a separate bathroom? One would never expect that of a Sheraton, but instead, only lower class hotels, which this one ended up being. You should be embarrassed. Everything was outdated, from carpet to fixtures to the bed.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything
review.locationRemarks: The only passable thing about the hotel was the location.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean and staff were efficient.   Wonderful price for the location. I will stay there again when in the Bay Area

review.title: Air condicioning louder than a truck
review.reviewText: The air unit is so old and noisy that we had to turn it off the hole night so we could sleep, incredible for a four season

review.title: Nice hotel but they desperately need to recarpet.
review.reviewText: Great location. Close to restaurants, shopping, freeways, easy access to San Francisco, and amtrak train station.

review.title: Practical and clean
review.reviewText:
We selected this hotel for one night since we were coming to the bay area from Sacramento. It is very easy access to and around the bay area and that is why I selected it. The price was competitive as well. Upon arrival the hotel lobby, front desk and surrounding areas were very clean, bright and friendly and efficient staff. Took 5 minutes to check-in.
The room was as we expected or a little more than we expected. I would stay here again! Just out 10 minute drive to San Francisco without the crazy congestion and high costs of staying in SF.
review.negativeRemarks: Speed of elevator.
review.locationRemarks: Close to great restaurants, great shopping within walking distance. Close to bay meadows, close to downtown Oakland and San Francisco

review.title: Nice hotel in a terrible location
review.reviewText: My overall experience was ok. The rooms were overall average but very small and the location was not good. It was very noisy on the street and it overlooked the freeway.
review.negativeRemarks: larger rooms, larger bathroom.
review.locationRemarks: Terrible location! Very noisy all night long! We did not get any sleep all night. Hallways were noisy in am/pm

review.title: Sunset by the Bay
review.reviewText: Our 3-night stay was pleasant, quiet, and comfortable. The friendly welcome of front desk staff, especially, Salma, took away the weariness of our travel aches and pains. Ms. Salma's genuine "welcoming" hospitality deserves a commendation. We flew in from Florida to bid my mother "goodbye" as we laid her to rest. Our stay was like "the balm of Gilead" for our weary souls. We highly recommend you and, if ever we head your way again, reserve us room 704. Watch the colorful Sunset by the Bay.
review.positiveRemarks: Overall friendliness of staff, including housekeeping & the early morning sweeper of the parking lot. The hotel facility's cleanliness, gym, pool, esp
review.negativeRemarks: Cafeteria food choices & quality.
review.locationRemarks: Hub of activities: shopping galore, diners, specialty stores, and freeway accessibility.

review.title: Okay... Nothing fancy but overall average
review.reviewText: Stayed one night. On checking in the receptionist seemed irritated and rude. When sands about food he was rude and said look at the time everything's closed. When getting into the room, it was clean and neat. Nothing out of average. Good for a casual stay.

review.title: Convenient location - right off freeway but quiet
review.reviewText: Easy to get in and out - free parking and wi-fi was a plus. Try People's donuts nearby - amazing!

review.title: convenient and lovely.
review.reviewText: bright and clean, great value for the price with location near highways and right in the heart of emeryville.

review.title: Nice hotel with clean rooms and excellent staff
review.reviewText: I only stayed in this hotel for one night. The staff at reception was warm and room was clean. It had facilities like an iron, ironing board, safety deposit box, hair drier etc. I asked for tooth paste which I forgot to bring along and it was provided within minutes. I asked them about hot water and was having some problem. A staff member came up to my room within few minutes and sorted it out. They called taxi for me in the morning and my invoice was ready by the time I got to the reception. Overall good experience!

review.title: Nice hotel in a great area, close to bay
review.reviewText: Staff was extremely friendly and helpful..Clean..Great location, walking distance from shops and restaurants
review.locationRemarks: walking trails, shops, restaurants, a movie theater all within walking distance, the  Berkeley marina is a short drive..

review.title: San Fran for the Weekend
review.reviewText: The Four Points had the most reasonable price around, and the quality of the staff and accommodations were fantastic. I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Free parking
review.reviewText: Great time! Close to restaurants and a shopping mall. Easy access to the freeway too.

review.title: Recent stay
review.reviewText: Was in town less than 24 hours. Maybe I was tired, but the bed was VERY comfortable!

review.title: Great Get away at Four Points!
review.reviewText: Location was great! The staff was beyond helpful,and the hotel was in good condition! My boyfriend and i enjoyed our stay as first timers here!

review.title: Room is too small.
review.reviewText:
Room is too small.
Even up-graded room is also small.

review.title: Good staff
review.reviewText: A very convenient place just beside the highway. Close to shopping stretch and restaurants so no lacking of food. Friendly staff . Free parking and free wifi a definite plus.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping. Good restaurants.

review.title: Hotel in Emeryville
review.reviewText: Ok experience if taking a short vacation last minute. Was not aware of last minute card hold they didn't seem to care
review.negativeRemarks: Maintenance, better television channels, price for such hotel was not right, pictures advertised made rooms look much bigger
review.locationRemarks: Crowded because near a freeway, but not too far from Berkeley, Bart, and SF bridge.

review.title: Great hotel near San Francisco
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful stay for three nights. Rooms was comfortable and very clean. Location was great as their are restaurants next door and across the street. Also the neighborhood is very safe. Although you cannot walk to the Bart station, their is a shuttle bus across the street that will take you to the station which is about 15 minutes away. Since we drove from LA we took the car to the station and only paid two dollars parking, all day; and took the Bart ( MacArthur Station) into San Francisco. For the price we paid it was a lot cheaper than staying inside San Francisco where we still had to pay for daily parking at the hotels. Next time we come back to San Francisco, we will surely stay at this hotel as it is very convenient to everything.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, very close to San Francisco.
review.locationRemarks: Close to UC Berkley, restaurants across the streets and close to Bart Station by car or shuttle. Also the Bay Bridge into San Francisco is near hotel

review.title: Very friendly staff, close to mall, transportation
review.reviewText: I was on a business trip and had to find a hotel with a good distance to my meeting places. I was skeptical about a relatively low (88% vs > 95%) recommendation rate. I was then surprised by very friendly staff and found Emery Go Around (a free shuttle service) pretty convenient to bring me to BART's MacArthur station. I recommend this one.
review.locationRemarks: It's close to a mall, Emery Public Market with many choices to eat, Emery Go Around bus stop, Trader Joe' (across the street) which is very handy.

review.title: Tried another Sheraton property in the bay area
review.reviewText: I selected this hotel based on its proximity to my daughter's college. The amenities description said that the hotel had room service, but it did not. There is only one restaurant nearby if you don't want to drive somewhere. The hotel has a bar and an area where breakfast is served, but you cannot get dinner there. There was a microwave and fridge in the room, so we ended up going to the Trader Joe's across the street to get our dinner.
review.negativeRemarks: This hotel does not offer room service - the description of the amenities should be corrected.

review.title: Convenient location to freeway and shopping
review.reviewText: Room was clean and comfortable. Staff was very professional and courteous. Hotel lobby was undergoing remodeling, so there was construction equipment in the middle of the lobby. Because of the remodeling, the breakfast was only a continental breakfast. Otherwise, construction did not impact the comfort of my stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient to freeway, shopping, restaurants and movie theater. Plenty of free parking!
review.negativeRemarks: I'm sure once the remodeling is complete it will be a great place. Will definitely return.

review.title: Cool
review.reviewText: Like my room ,king bed sweet,but their continentl breakfeast was the worst ever had by breakfast anyway that was disappointing otherwise location, room,staff cool hope hurry and finsh remodeling before i return.

review.title: Renovations...ugh!
review.reviewText: The hotel was under construction so it wasn't as nice as the last time I stayed there. I have no real complaints about it so I guess I would say I enjoyed it.

review.title: Comfortable place with great staff
review.reviewText: Pretty good place to stay. The staff is cheerful, ready to help. Interesting cultural mix of guests. Breakfast buffet was good. They had hard boiled eggs, plenty of fruit along with a selection of everything else you would expect. The bathroom was uncommonly tiny.

review.title: Nothing special but perfectly adequate
review.reviewText:
Stayed for 4 nights and was satisfied with everything. Shame BART were on strike which hampered getting into and out of San Fran, but it was nice to return to the slightly calmer Bay area at the end of the day.
Good position for shops, cinema and breakfast at Denny's.
review.negativeRemarks: Include breakfast in the room deal.

review.title: Convenient location, looking tired
review.reviewText: Very good East Bay Location --- By car, it is convenient to Berkeley, Oakland and San Francisco. Next to an outdoor mall so shopping and restaurants nearby. Very friendly staff. The DOWNSIDE is that it could use some new furnishings ---- the bed was not very comfortable, the carpets look old, and new furniture, chosen with the room in mind, would make a big difference.

review.title: Ok
review.reviewText: Hotel is just south of Berkley, and easy drive to San Francisco just across bridge. (traffic dependent of course) Also short drive to Oakland airport.
review.positiveRemarks: Decent central location to get to several places.
review.negativeRemarks: Shower heads are too low. Wake up call did not happen.

review.title: Short but sweet
review.reviewText: We only stayed 1 night but the room was very clean, the beds were combfortable and the shower was good. So many times now days they short change you on the shower facilities. Overall we were very pleased with our stay. The little cafe in the hotel was nice and helped us get on the road again quickly. The people working there were all very nice and helped us with anything that we asked of them.
review.positiveRemarks: Soft beds, a good size bathroom. Close to stores and restaurants if you need them. Nice people that were very helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: It is so close to a busy street that our room was very noisy from the traffic. Maybe is there was some way to soundproof some of the rooms better that
review.locationRemarks: Oakland, CA close to a Trader Joe's, a nice Restaurant, Star Bucks Coffee and several clothing stores.

review.title: Stayed for three nights.
review.reviewText: Booked this hotel at the end of a two and half week family holiday to Vegas, Santa Clara, Yosemite and Lake Tahoe with my wife and 14 year old son. Found the rooms to be clean and tidy (we had a room with two queen sized beds) and the staff to be very helpful & friendly. There is a free shuttle opposite the hotel to the local BART station, which is a short journey into the heart of San Francisco. There is also a nice shopping centre within walking distance of this apparently redeveloped district. Prices reflect the out of city centre location and the rooms whilst not recently decorated were perfectly functional, clean & tidy. Plenty of places to eat nearby & within walking distance.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were particularly helpful, we stayed at 7 hotels on this trip (including one UK airport hotel) and the staff here were the most helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Some reviews we read prior to booking suggested that the hotel needed refurbishment/deep clean but this wasn't really evident from our stay.
review.locationRemarks: See above.

review.title: Convenient location but just okay room
review.reviewText:
First, I must say we arrived very late at night but the staff still accommodated our request for 2 beds, which we did appreciate. However, I did have a couple of issues with our room. First, the air conditioning unit was apparently leaking as the carpet was all wet about 4 feet all around it. We reported it when we checked out in the morning.
The other issue I have with the room might not bother others, but it does my family. The sink is located in the bedroom area, not in the shower room. I rise early and shower and then had to use a noisy blow dryer in the room where others are trying to sleep! Why can't the sink and electric plugs be in the room with the toilet and shower as it is in other hotels? At the very least, a picture of that end of the room on the website should show this configuration, so I can pick a different hotel in the future.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was good for UC Berkeley and San Francisco
review.negativeRemarks: Put the sink in the bathroom, not in the bedroom!

review.title: Quiet, great location
review.reviewText: Far enough from SF to be quiet, but within reach of the city. Will stay here again. Pleasant staff, nice towels, and ridiculously comfy pillows and bed.
review.positiveRemarks: location, pillows, bed, staff, fridge, microwave, towels, fast elevators, coffee machine, T.V., that we hardly saw anyone
review.negativeRemarks: Carpet in the hallway was beginning to show its age.
review.locationRemarks: Far enough from SF to be quiet, but within reach of the city.

review.title: affordable, close to san francisco
review.reviewText: An affordable option just over the bay bridge from San Francisco. This hotel was nice, updated, clean, easy to get to, and much lower priced than many hotels in the downtown San Fran area. The rooms were a little small - the bathroom and sink area was tiny, but all was nice and clean. Starbucks and Trader Joes across the street for snacks, etc.

review.title: Nice clean hotel with great staff!
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed the friendliness of the hotel staff and the quickness of the room service. I also enjoyed the location it was easily accessible. I do wish they had a continental breakfast but the cafe they had was great for a reasonable price. The rooms were kept clean and were very comfortable and roomy.
review.negativeRemarks: The hot water in the showers.
review.locationRemarks: There's a shopping center near by

review.title: Nice hotel. Gives you great access to the bart.
review.reviewText: I enjoyed the free bus rides to the Bart. Nice shops all around the neighborhood that the hotel is in. Also a movie theatre in walking distance and great food nearby!
review.positiveRemarks: Seemed to be a safe neighborhood. The breakfast by the lobby has actually really good food. The room was very clean and new looking. Comfortable beds.
review.negativeRemarks: The water temp in the shower didn't get very hott. :(
review.locationRemarks: Movie theatre, pool hall/bar, bars, urban outfitters store, wide variety of restaurants. Anybody could find a restaurant they would enjoy. Also IKEA

review.title: Helpful staff
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean and the staff was very helpful. We were upgraded to a larger room because of availability, which was nice. The staff called a cab for us and let us know when it had arrived. The bathroom was small and the shampoo dispensers were empty, which was pretty much my only negative. Overall, it was a very nice stay in a convenient location.
review.negativeRemarks: Refill the shampoo and conditioner in showers and make sure the pumps are working.
review.locationRemarks: Close to shopping and Denny's for late nights! Short car ride to UC Berkeley.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Berkeley, DTSF, and Oakland.
review.reviewText: I enjoyed the location of this hotel. I was able to check out beautiful Berkeley, Union Square in Downtown SF, and drive up to Grizzly Peak. The hotel also has places to eat within walking distance.
review.negativeRemarks: Pool size
review.locationRemarks: Restaurants, grocery stores, and other stores.

review.title: Very economic no "extras". Not to homie...
review.reviewText: I picked this hotel because we added another night to our stay. We thought it would be nice to stay on the other side of the bay. Going over the bridges once to experience it is cool, but could not see my self doing it every day. Hotel is plan.....the staff was very helpful.....needed a second bed but no rooms were available. Staff gave me extra comforter.....my son didn't complain about floor. They don't have roll out beds.. Big difference from SF side of bridge......besides Berkely and passing by Pixar Studios (old) not much close by. Hotel room is small.......and very limited. Paid more than one in San Mateo and this one was smaller with less extras.....good if u are. Traveling alone and need a room in this area.
review.locationRemarks: Mall close by......family restaurant next door...did not try it.

review.title: Convenient location right before the Bay Bridge.
review.reviewText: We had very good experience. Very nice Bay view from our window. Towels were CLEAN. I enjoyed the Traders Joy's store within 1 minute walk. They provide microwave and refrigitator on request. Would be nice though if they had robes in the room as were promised on booking site. But otherwise it was great experience for the price. And I will stay in this hotel again.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient location for the smaller price. Hotel did not charge us any additional taxes and fees, it was a nice surprise for a change. It was quiet.
review.negativeRemarks: I'd like to have bath robes in the room
review.locationRemarks: Black bear diner, coffee shop, shoe store, Trader Joe's store

review.title: Walking distance to many locations
review.reviewText: Great place, and enjoyed the stay. Walked to the markets and shopping centers as well as my business meeting location. Nice location.

review.title: The "extras" made this a noteworthy experience!
review.reviewText:
Nice hotel, nice price. Except for the expected late Saturday night interruption of drunken guests, it was pretty quiet and peaceful. I'm not crazy about the smaller bathrooms I seem to notice at these Sheraton "4 points" hotels, (just stayed in a LA area one, 2 weeks ago. Same small bathroom -;) However i loved the shampoo (plus more) inside the shower...quite convenient! Housekeeping though needs to check for refilling more often as conditioner container was near empty. Comfy bed and wonderful soft pillows to enjoy. Great lighting over sink area to do hair and make-up. And LOVE the swing out dual-focus mirror, nice touch!

Excellent front desk staff too. Helped with directions and information. As a hotel employee myself I notice all these little extras. I've stayed in some of the surrounding hotels and by far this was the best!

Thank you Sheraton, Stay like this and I'll be BACK!

review.title: Take the bay view rooms, it's worth the extra $10
review.reviewText: The staff at the hotel was very nice. My keys did not work at any point during the stay but the staff came up to help me open the door.

review.title: Get a good night's sleep.
review.reviewText: The beds,linens, and pillows are very comfortable. Room temperature is good. Amenities like refrigerator and coffee in room are nice. Bathroom is small and sink area is tight. Staff very pleasant and accommodating. Computers and printer available in business office. I wouldn't pay extra for the bay view as the bay is far away and the view includes two highways.Good location near stores.
review.negativeRemarks: small bathroom and sink area
review.locationRemarks: near lots of stores

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: The room was nice and clean, bed very comfortable and I loved all the big fluffy pillows!

review.title: Our anniversary by AMTRAK
review.reviewText: We had a wonderful stay, the staff was polite and so helpful explaining to us how to traverse the area by shuttle and BART. The room was very clean and the bedding excellent. The hotel lobby was inviting and we would stay again at this hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff, the lobby and excellent coffee in the morning.
review.negativeRemarks: The breakfast buffet.
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is located in Emeryville, Ca., very close and convenient to shopping and dining.

review.title: Convenient clean
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean, staff helpful, a good location. The bathroom was very small and tight; that was the only problem. (however, if you are a coffee fanatic, might want to bring your own quality grounds).
review.negativeRemarks: Very small bathroom
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient to freeway and nearby shopping.

review.title: Great hotel for families...
review.reviewText: Although the room was smaller than other competitive hotels, the condition and cleanliness of the hotel was great. Would definitely recommend for families.

review.title: Excellent hotel and location
review.reviewText: Very nice customer service and the hotel very clean and excellent location, I will stay again in the hotel..
review.positiveRemarks: the room, gym and the coffee shop
review.negativeRemarks: I didn't see any bad thing on it..

review.title: less stress for a family of 5
review.reviewText: We visited San Francisco for the day then drove to the hotel. We chose this hotel because it wasn't' far from the city and we did not want to spent more on parking. With a family of 5 it made vacation easier. The kids loved the pool.
review.positiveRemarks: Heated pool. Comfortable beds and clean
review.negativeRemarks: No Continental breakfast

review.title: hotel for a family
review.reviewText: the hot tub and the swimming pool was good and they even have a microwave in the room. However, it does not have awesome bay view as I expected. There is a freeway stand between the hotel and the bay.

review.title: Disappointed Guest
review.reviewText: Prior to making reservations, I read mixed reviews from bad to good. Therefore, I decided to stay at this hotel since is was a Sheraton Hotel and was in a good location for my purposes. My husband and I checked in around 3 p.m.and the reservation lady was very friendly; after check-in, the hotel called to asked if we were satified with our room and we stated we were fine. After spending the night, I am disappointed to agree with the reviews that are negative. These comments are as follows: A 3ft length sink/counter area outside the bathroom. The bathroom floor space is 5ft by 3ft with door barely missing toilet. The train tracks were near the hotel and trains kept me awake most the night. In the morning, we were not able to take a show/bath because the plumbing fixtures in the tub/shower would not turn on and the tub was dirty. I then noticed that the bedding had no fitted bottom sheet,too small for matress and was old off-color. During check-out, we report that the plumbing fixtures in the tub/shower do not work and were unable to use. Mr Chan reponded that he was sorry but stated no customers have ever reported this issue.

review.title: Good sleep- good service
review.reviewText:
Ive stayed at this hotel a few times- and its always a quick check-in... in walking distance of starbucks and some great shopping- and easy to get on/off the freeway from.
Im picky about cleanliness- and the hotel rooms are always clean and comfy.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location! SO much in walking distance surrounding hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathrooms could be a little bigger.
review.locationRemarks: GREAT location... Emeryville is a great place to stay. Clean and cozy.

review.title: The Nicest Hotel Staff I've Ever Met
review.reviewText: The staff at the Four Points by Sheraton is incredible - their friendliness and willingness to help went above and beyond my expectations. The shuttle to the BART station is convenient, although it's not the same as staying in San Francisco (especially if you're travelling alone and want to go in after dark). The hotel is located next to a great shopping centre with a movie theatre and restaurants, so if you decide not to make the journey into SF, there's enough to do here. There's also a Trader Joe's across the street to buy food from and stock your in-room fridge.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff were so helpful and went out of their way to make my stay great. My king bed was very comfortable and I had a great view of the bay.
review.negativeRemarks: The food at the conference was fairly repetitive and bland.
review.locationRemarks: I wouldn't stay here if your sole purpose was to visit San Francisco. But if you're visiting Emervyville or the Bay area, definitely stay here.

review.title: Clean but poor WiFi service.
review.reviewText: The hotel WiFi was not reliable - sometimes it worked and other times it did not. The hotel restaurant was understaffed and I can understand slower service but I was not greeted at all until 10 minutes AFTER I sat down; this is not acceptable to me.

review.title: Pls improve quality of the brakfast
review.reviewText:
Very disappointed with the breakfast....black/dried over fried saugage and beacon.The toast must be the left over of yesterday morning...
However, the staff is very helpful and polite.

review.title: Not what I expected.
review.reviewText:
We were given the wrong hotel room number, as we tried opening the door there was clearly someone else in there.

The shower wasn't working completely, the bathtub faucet was still spewing water out which was pretty loud sound too. The shower head was too short.

The room keycard would constantly deactivate.

The overall bathroom was too small and barely fit one person and it was so small that the sink was outside the bathroom in the hallway of the room itself which was kinda weird.

I thought pretty highly of Sheraton but after this experience I'd rather pay the extra $20 or $30 and stay at a Hyatt.
review.negativeRemarks: the small bathroom and barely working bathtub faucet and shower head.
review.locationRemarks: It's in a great area next to an outdoor shopping mall and public market.

review.reviewText: Close to the freeway and very clean; however our room was not ready when we arrived.

review.title: Business hotel with a great location & warm staff.
review.reviewText: Our weekend was miserable, rainy weather but the hotel staff were cheerful and helpful. Even the small bar in the lobby was a nice place for drink, lite fare and everyone enjoying the televised football game. When a hotel can help you through uncontrollable condictions, you know you're at the right place!
review.positiveRemarks: The staff and the location to shops, restaurants and theatre.
review.negativeRemarks: They refused us access to the continental breakfast because we had discounted reservations. Made the manager appear petty and not client-centered.

review.title: You could do better
review.reviewText: For the price I paid, I expected more. The rooms are definitely in need of some updating. I reserved a bayview king that was confirmed until midnight. I checked in just past midnight and was told that room was no longer available. Instead, I was put in a room without a view with a full size bed, barely big enough for 2 of us. I was not reimbursed for the difference in the price. The room was very cramped, you could hardly move around. It's in a great spot - walking distance to a shopping center and right off the freeway. I was disappointed with the customer service and quality of the room. I think you could do better.
review.negativeRemarks: in need of repair, small rooms, poor customer service

review.title: Solid value
review.reviewText: We liked this hotel and would come back again. Service was great, room was very clean but the hallway could use some updating.

review.title: Good business traveler's hotel.
review.reviewText: Conveniently located hotel; close to San Francisco and Berkeley. There are restaurants close by and a Trader Joe's. I was able to buy food and keep it in the mini fridge and warm up meals in the microwave provided in my room. The staff was courteous and helpful. The free wi-fi was great. I would definitely stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: The a/c unit was a bit loud.
review.locationRemarks: I had a nice view of the San Francisco bay.

review.title: Horrible
review.reviewText: Worst service ever. The third time they told me the manager was "in a meeting" guaranteed to me that they don't give a crap about there clients. Worst experience EVER.

review.title: Clean and adequate, but older property.
review.reviewText:
There isn't anything wrong with the hotel. It's just an old building. 70-80s looking carpet, but it's clean and kept up. Aesthetically boring to a fault.

The rooms are plenty large, but not as big as the Hilton Garden Suites across the street, but adequate. Sheraton bathrooms are much smaller than the Hilton, which has a huge bathroom separate from the main living area. Sheraton has a sink in the same room and a small separate both area. Hilton has refridges, Sheraton does not.

Both the Hilton and the Sheraton have desks and a nice business chair, but again, the Hilton has a bigger desk and chair. Both have a reading chair and foot rest with light.

Both Hilton and Sheraton have easy access to the I80 to SF. Both have a small gym and hot tub. Sheraton has a small, really small, pool too.

Staff and cleanliness at both hotels was superb.

I'd stay at the Hilton if I could book for the same price, otherwise I'd go Sheraton to save money--after all, you're not living there.

I would not pay more than 140 a night at either place.

If you're hotel budget is higher, and you would rather spend most of your time in SF, (instead of having to drive across the 80 each time at 5 bucks a pop) just go for one of the boutique hotels in SF itself.
review.positiveRemarks: Easy access to freeways and good eateries nearby.
review.negativeRemarks: An older hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Places to eat, Barnes and Noble, shopping. Safe location.

review.title: Enjoyable stay
review.reviewText: Good location and spacious room. Easy acess from freeway and convenient to shops, cafes

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: Upon checking-in, Elsie (front desk staff) was friendly and helpful. Kids enjoyed the pool all to themselves :) the weekend we were there. The pool location was located at the front side of the hotel and had pretty good privacy with the shrubs/plants along the metal fence. Plenty food places and stores close by. Only minor drawback is the tiny bathroom when it comes to opening the door, but overall the room condition was good and clean. Pluses were complimentary wifi, microwave and mini refrigerator in room.

review.title: bad day
review.reviewText: I sleep in the day and work at noc. I always receive a room that is noisy and the carpet never looks clean in the halway. room appear to have a scent smoke eventhough rooms are nonsmoking.
review.negativeRemarks: 6th floor very noisy, carpet not clean in hallway
review.locationRemarks: ok

review.title: Great hotel to visit San Fransico
review.reviewText: It was excellent for the price. If you dont want to stay in downtown San Fransico its a great place to travel from. Only 9 miles from fishermans wharf. My older daughters and I went and went sightseeing everyday and because of lower room cost had more to spend in San Fransico. The only thing i would not recomend was the breakfast buffet at the hotel. Burned coffee and poor food.
review.negativeRemarks: Cafe
review.locationRemarks: Oakland, but easy drive to san fransico

review.title: My Stay
review.reviewText: Very clean and quite. Great location and a Professional staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing, great visit to SF.
review.locationRemarks: Next to Golden State Bridge.

review.title: Nice for a weekend get away.
review.reviewText: Good location, pleasant staff, rooms were clean...bathroom a bit small. Overall, nice for the value.

review.title: Clean, FREE WIFI INSIDE ROOM, close to UC Berkeley
review.reviewText:
Last year (Aug 2011), we took our niece to start college at UC Berkeley. We needed a responsible priced hotel in a safe location that was fairly close to UC Berkeley. We also hate to pay for parking and we wanted free Wifi. I know we were only going to sleep in the hotel room, but we wanted something a little better than a motel. So last year (Aug 2011), we stayed at the Garden Hilton Hotel that's across the street. They DID NOT have free Wifi INSIDE the room. It was only available in the lobby. What an inconvenience that was!!

So this year (Aug 2012), we stayed at the Four Points Sheraton and we loved it! Price was very reasonable and they had free Wifi INSIDE the rooms! Plus, they have free coffee service in the lobby until 10am. Be sure to get some before 10am.

The room is clean and we loved the warm comforters and the free bottle of Arrowhead water in the room.

There's a Trader Joe's market across the street, as well as a discount clothing store called Ross and a discount shoe store too. We bought my niece some school clothes there. The hotel is located close to the freeway, but you could not hear the freeway noise. The hotel is pretty close to UC Berkeley (about 7 minutes away). And if you wanted to drive into San Francisco, it's a great location because the bridge to San Francisco is close by.

We will definitely stay in this hotel in the future!
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee service in lobby ended at 10am.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. 7 minutes from UC Berkeley. 5 minutes from bridge to take you to San Francisco.

review.title: Vacation
review.reviewText: Excellent service, clean rooms/beds, not too noisy, close to SF, shops and restaurants across the street. Even though we commuted to the UC Berkley campus daily it was a much better experience in Evansville. Also free parking!
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Near SF and Berkley

review.title: Accomadated very early check-in
review.reviewText: We need a hotel that was close to the Alta Bates Medical center that allowed early check in because my daughter was in early labor and lived several hours from the hospital. We didn't want her to have to be riding in the car during the later stages of labor. This hotel graciously accommodated our request for 8am check-in so that my daughter would have someplace to stay during the early stages of labor It was comfortable and very clean. BTW: My daughter had a healthy baby later that day at the Alta Bates Medical center..
review.positiveRemarks: Lots of pillows, comfortable bedding, accommodating early check-in
review.negativeRemarks: Amtrak and Bart ran behind the hotel, but I did not hear them during the night.
review.locationRemarks: It is close to the freeway, but the google directions had the hotel on the opposite side of the street. Amtrak and Bart run right behind hotel.

review.title: Would NOT stay here again !
review.reviewText: Just not what we 'pictured.' The bathroom was so small that you could not open/shut the door unless your whole body was In the bathroom #had to step over the toilet to close the door-very cramped space#. My husband tripped over some towels next to the toilet/shower and almost fell in the shower. The TV had fuzzy reception and was barely watchable. The hot tub wasnt HOT #warm at best#. There was complimentary cofffee in the am, although if you wanted a muffin/bagel you had to pay extra #and the muffin was stale and tasted horrible#. On the internet it shows the shops/restaurants just outside of the hotel. In reality the shops/restaurants are down the street #walk or drive to#. I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone.
review.negativeRemarks: Cramped room, warm hot tub, loud street noise
review.locationRemarks: Right off of Powell and the traffic noise was HORRIBLE (couldnt sleep)

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Clean, good customer service. Good location if you are interested in being on that side of the bay. Good location to get to many locations. Try Tilden park if you like to hike.

review.title: Don't Stay Here!
review.reviewText: Here's the list: 1. Bathroom floor filthy upon check-in 2. House man showed up and moved dirt around w/a dry towel. I had to insist he use soap & water and he pointed out that he was not the housekeeper. I simply pointed out that I was not placing my feet on a dirty floor and that he either mop it or we we're checking out 3. Light in bathroom flickered and bathroom sink leaked when water was on. All rooms booked so we couldnt change. 4. Buffet breakfast was cold. Complained to staff who pointed out the food in placed in the morning and that by 10am it is no longer warm. Ok. Yep, I'd never stay here again. 5. Since it was apparent they half cleaned the rooms, i placed the sign on the door (do not disturb, not now later please) so that my room was not cleaned or entered. I left for breakfast and returned to find the sign gone and my room "cleaned". While i'm mulling this other, i hear a knock on the door. Before i could answer the Housekeeper supervisor is entering my room to check that it was cleaned! WTH! I could have been naked or having sex! I can't ever!
review.negativeRemarks: The hotel rooms
review.locationRemarks: centrally located to shopping areas

review.title: Adequate Emeryville hotel
review.reviewText:
The room was sufficient and the location was good; central to Berkeley and San Francisco and good shopping in Emeryville. The room was adequate size (but not large) and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom is very small. The two main problems were that the fan was on all night and quite loud. I could've turned it off, but I didn't want it to get stuffy and it was drowning out problem #2: the toilet was leaking. This wouldn't happen in every room, I gather. Finally, I went down to the spa and it was closed due to a broken filter. It had just happened so there was no time to fix it; the staff was very apologetic, but still I didn't get to use that feature.

If the price is right, this place is good, but I've stayed in better places in Emeryville.

review.title: Review of Four Points by Sheraton
review.reviewText: Rooms are small with little space in the bathroom, sink area and closet. This reflects an aging facility and one we stay in when everything else is booked. We have stayed in the Woodfin Suites for the same cost where the size of the rooms and amenities (restaurant) are much nicer.
review.negativeRemarks: It does not have the amenities commensurate with the room fees.
review.locationRemarks: Highway and train noise is problematic late at night/early morning.

review.title: nice
review.reviewText: The bathroom floor where it met the door could have been cleaner. The doors should close with less noise, so we are not as not to wake us when neighbors come and go.

review.title: nice staff
review.reviewText: Rooms were clean, and a little on the small size.would like to have two queen beds as instead of the doubles they offer.The A/C was not working in our room.served it's purpose
review.negativeRemarks: Small beds

review.title: Good not great.
review.reviewText: This was the second time I've stayed here and both times were fine. Cleanliness is good and front desk friendliness is good. The bar and food selections left so much to be desired. I ordered one drink that was horrible and no food. I had to walk across to the Denny's out of desperation. The maid service was great. Putting my room exactly how I liked rather than a set formula each night which was a personal touch I really appreciated. Overall it was good.
review.negativeRemarks: Bar and food selections
