review.locationRemarks: Close enough to shops but not much food close

review.title: nice place, very clean and pleasant
review.reviewText: nice place to stay, near restaurants and the bay street mall

review.title: Room review
review.reviewText: I Didn't like having the large pillows. It was a waste of space in my opinion. The room was so so. Not much to say, it was ok.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked how friendly and pleasant the staffs were.
review.negativeRemarks: The room was too compact. The bathroom was small.

review.title: Friendly staff. Good location.
review.reviewText: Staff was great. Hotel was clean but crowded. Enjoyed my stay but it was also noisy with the train passing by.

review.title: Sheraton on Berkeley-Oakland border
review.reviewText: The general area is a bit rundown: boarded up restaurant next door; questionable parking security, especially along north side of hotel. Pleasant staff, and cleanliness overall was good enough. Double-bed room was just big enough for two adults and two kids, with no room to spare. Door onto balcony was marginally operable. Morning coffee in lobby was good, but no continental breakfast was available. Parking in back of hotel was a little dark at night, and room key did not operate the back door, so had to carry stuff around to the front.
review.positiveRemarks: In an area central to other activities.
review.negativeRemarks: Marginal location.
review.locationRemarks: See in description.

review.title: So So Stay at the Sheraton
review.reviewText: I have stayed at this hotel for maybe 5 times in the past 2 years. Each time I have stayed there was always a microwave and fridge in the room. This last time there was not one. There was also a noisy family with kids across the hallway. This past experience was not that enjoyable.
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms are clean and there is a small gym on the property
review.negativeRemarks: Noisy guests in the hallway
review.locationRemarks: Close to the interstate highway 80 and within walking distance of lots of shopping and eateries

review.title: Overnight en route to SFO
review.reviewText:
The Sheraton Four Points was a very convenient place for us to stay on our way to San Francisco. We really appreciated the free parking and free WiFi--we saved a bundle on these and the room charge compared to what we would have paid had we spent the night in SFO. It was easy getting to/from the freeway so we were at our destination in SFO plenty early on Saturday morning.

The breakfast buffet (extra charge) was surprisingly good: Lots of fresh tasty fruit, pastries, sausages, eggs, bacon, etc.
review.locationRemarks: Easy on/off freeway, near a big shopping plaza that looked like it was worth exploring

review.title: I'll be back
review.reviewText:
The hotel staff was friendly and allowed me to check in at noon instead of waiting until 3pm. The room was very small. Barely room enough to squeeze between the bed and TV. It was wide enough to fit a crib inside and the hotel provided a complimentary microwave and fridge so I could store baby milk. Another perk was the free parking. It was plentiful. Other hotels in the area charge $8-$10 per day for parking.

There were lots of shopping options in walking distance of the hotel as well as food. We ate at Denny's across the street. Beware of the man dressed like Moses equipped with a walking cane on the only path to the only door of the restaurant. He's homeless but not aggressive and feeds the seagulls so we were worried about droppings. The service at the Denny's wasn't great so we didn't eat there again.

The hotel is near the frreway which made traveling easier for us. I will stay at this hotel when I visit again.
review.positiveRemarks: Free parking, complimentary microwave and fridge.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms are really small
review.locationRemarks: Close to food, shopping and the freeway.

review.title: Good for the price
review.reviewText: I priced several hotels in the area and found this one to be the best rate. The hotel was very nice and clean. I paid extra for a city view room which was lovely over looking the bay. The only down side was the room was very small. I am an average sized person and just had enough room to walk comfortably between the bed and TV stand. The bathroom was tiny as well I could barely get the door shut without standing in the tub. I would stay here again if I were still on a budget.

review.title: We had a very good experience, courteous staff, nice room
review.reviewText: We had a very good experience, courteous staff, nice room

review.title: great place to stay
review.reviewText: very good hotel to stay at. Kind and curtious staff, rooms are emmaculate.

review.title: Very friendly hotel with lovely rooms
review.reviewText: I chose the hotel because it was close to Emeryville train station and I had an early train to catch. I probably wouldn't stay in the area otherwise, but I was pleasantly suprised by the warmth of the welcome I received, and my room was large and very well equipped. The free WiFi was also very welcome.

review.title: pretty pricey, but nice place
review.reviewText: the room was a little small. i was expecting bigger for what i was paying. but the room was clean and the staff was nice. everything close by so very convenient.

review.title: Average Hotel
review.reviewText: I expected this to be a better hotel than it was. The rooms were average but the hallways smelled musty.

review.title: Bay Area
review.reviewText: Great!

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was fine.

review.title: Nice
review.reviewText:
The Asian ladies at the front desk were not really that friendly. A smile would have been nice. Felt they just wanted to quickly check us in. They never asked us if we preferred a high or low floor; a view or no view, etc. In that sense, the service was not all that great.

The Asian maid was VERY GOOD though!

review.title: 4 Point Sheraton Emeryville
review.reviewText:
Very nice. Well maintained. Extremely friendly and helpful staff. Well located-close to SF, Oakland and Berkeley. If you ask for the Bay side, you get a great view of SF.

Only complain is the bathroom was a bit small. Other than that, it was a good choice.

review.title: Good hotel but no free breakfast..
review.reviewText: The hotel was conveniently located for the A's game we were going to the next day. I waited a little too long at the reception desk because two employees were helping one couple check in and one of them should have been helping me. The room was good, nothing amazing, but fine for what we paid. I was however, very disappointed that there was no free breakfast. If we wanted something to eat we had to pay $13 a person for the buffet which we thought was very high, so we just went across the street to Denny's and paid a lot less. I would stay here again because of the value and convenience but I was not thrilled.

review.title: Four Points by Sheraton
review.reviewText: I thought that the bathroom was very small.

review.title: Sheraton Four Points
review.reviewText:
The hotel in Emeryville was convenient for me. It was close to many restaurants and shopping areas. The hotel room was clean, and when I would sleep in and leave late, the rooms were cleaned in the afternoon by the time I came back.

The only downside was that there was no small, free continental breakfast. For the price of the rooms, I would to prefer to not have to pay extra for breakfast.

review.title: Best stay in the East Bay
review.reviewText:
Our overall experience was very pleasant. The staff was extremely helpful and pleasant at all times. The restaurant experience was great as was the 'girl wonder' who did it all (i.e. took orders, waited and bused tables and cleaned up, etc).

We would definitely stay at the 4 Points again, especially the facility in Emeryville, CA.

Thank you

review.title: Best Deal in Emeryville
review.reviewText:
Convenient to San Francisco, Oakland and Emeryville, the Sheraton Four Points is comfortable, safe, and impeccably clean. The staff are all friendly and helpful. With a seven-day stay, they provided a fridge and microwave in my room at no extra cost.
You can walk to a lovely bayside park, enjoying the salt air and fresh breezes, with a Jamba Juice or Starbucks in hand from the plaza across the street from the hotel and on the way to the park.
20 minutes from the Oakland airport. An Emery-go-Round stop is across the street from the hotel: free shuttle transportation circulating around Emeryville to the shopping areas and the BART. Car rentals are all walking distance from the hotel. Amtrak, also walking distance from the hotel, provides an approximately-hourly bus (20 minute ride!) over to San Francisco for a modest charge.

review.title: We will come back, great location.
review.reviewText: Location, location, location. This hotel was a block from shopping mall, the freeway and restaurants. We were attending events in Oakland on one day and two in San Francisco and the location made it easy to get to all events. It is clean, quiet and affordable. Parking was free.

review.title: Great Location in the Middle of the Bay Area
review.reviewText: We arrived early and were able to check in without trouble. The room was decent with all the upgrades like modern furniture and flat screen tv. Location wise, this hotel is right across the Bay Bridge to San Francisco and extremely close to Oakland, Berkeley and the North and East Bay cities. The only thing is if you are going into San Francisco frequently, you will have to pay bridge toll every time you cross the bridge in that direction.

review.title: Not so great
review.reviewText: Front desk was courteous, but hotel is old and in need of face lift. The room faintly smelled of smoke, even though it was a non-smoking hotel. Room was dark and bed, old. That being said, it is in a good location and inexpensive.

review.title: Nice place!
review.reviewText: Nice, well appointed hotel. Was more expensive than I was originally looking for, but did an excellent job earning the rate.

review.title: Return visitor
review.reviewText: See above.

review.title: Liked the Neighborhood
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean, comfortable, and had great shopping and food around the hotel.

review.title: A very pleasant place to stay
review.reviewText: We had a great experience, The staff was very courteous. They had free coffee in the lobby every morning. You could use their business center if needed for free. The rooms were a little small but clean and provided everything we needed. The hotel was located near a plaza where you could walk to restaurants or shopping.

review.title: "Uncomfortable Stay"
review.reviewText: The hotel was very clean and the staff friendly. The location of the hotel is great. However, the walls were very thin and we heard everything in the neighboring rooms and hallway. The bathroom was so small that it was hard to maneuver. I think the entire floor of the shower area was 3' wide. The AC unit was so noisy that we had to turn it off at night leaving the room stuffy when we awoke. This hotel has the worst selection of TV channels i have ever seen. I would stay there again only if the other Emeryville area hotels are booked.

review.title: pleasant experience
review.reviewText: read other reviews before booking for a business trip, found the hotel comfortable and clean and the staff to be both professional and courteous. many good places to eat that are with-in walking distance.the hotel's location makes any bay area connection easy.

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText: Straight forward deal. No frilss but good value given the cost.

review.title: Emeryville's Finest
review.reviewText: Would definitely stay again!! No complaints.

review.title: Great
review.reviewText: Great hotel

review.title: Decent hotel for the money
review.reviewText: A decent hotel for the money. Quite convenient to Oakland and Emeryville.

review.title: Nice clean and comfortable all for a great price
review.reviewText: We checked in late real late but still got everything that we asked for, the hotel staff was real friendly considering it was 3AM.. When we got to our room it was nice and clean just how we pictured it. We had a room on the top floor and it had a nice view of the bay bridge, the day that we checked out was a clear day and out in the distance you could see the Golden Gate. Breakfast buffet was good and very convenient.. Bathroom was a bit small but who cares.. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to family and friends...

review.title: Cool hotel
review.reviewText: Overall hotel was cool, the remote control was hooked up to the gameboy remote and was a pain to change the channel and the volume.

review.title: Good location - choose bay view
review.reviewText: A pleasant hotel, rooms are a bit small, but good for the location. Receptionist was unfriendly & persisted on not budging when it came to our request to get a room on a higher floor. She said the hotel was not full, we even offered to wait if they needed to clean rooms, she was stubborn for no specific reason.

review.title: very dirty
review.reviewText: Unclean and dirty. Hotel service was awfull.

review.title: Emeryville Sheraton 4 Points
review.reviewText: My hotel stay was great. The front desk workers were all pleasant and helpful. The room was clean, and comfortable. The bathroom was small but not an issue. It is centrally located close to the Bay Bridge so access to San Fran is 10 minutes. I would and plan on staying again.

review.title: Great Deal for the caishe
review.reviewText: The room was great, the flat screen TV was a little fuzzy on one station and we didn't get some cable stations (ie. comedy central) but we had a walk-out balcony/patio, a couch area and the bed was super comfy. It was a tad out-of-date, but on the flip side of that, maybe they will remodel soon!

review.title: NEVER! NEVER! NEVER!!!! if you don't wanna get vandalized.
review.reviewText: Ok, listen to me. This hotel has never taken care of customers' vehicles so it is a kinda famous and popular place for people who vandalize for a living. As a result, I spent $1,000 for a comprehension deductible and lost a pair of shoes($200), a hiking bag pack($500), clothes($1,000) and etc. Then the hotel just said "I feel sorry, we don't have any responsibility for this". Hmm.. very priceless experience for me. One more tip, hotels near Emeryville Bay Area usually join insurances for their parking facilities, "BUT FOUR POINTS BY SHERATON DOES NOT". I have to feel sorry about this, huh?

review.title: Close to Amtrak
review.reviewText: Both affordable and close to Amtrak as well as to restaurants and shopping.

review.title: Solid comfort
review.reviewText: The Four Points Sheraton offers easy access to San Francisco, Oakland, Berkeley and Emeryville. It provides comfortable rooms, in-room coffee makers and coffee and tea, room service, a small bar with evening hours, a business center, exercise room, a breakfast cafe, outdoor pool and hot tub. The staff is friendly and helpful; there are always apples and candy in baskets at the front desk, and the rooms are impeccably clean. Free parking is provided and the hotel is walking distance from shopping, restaurants, and a bay-side park with walking paths.

review.title: comfortable and clean
review.reviewText: Nice location. Friendly staff

review.title: Emeryville --- a best-kept secret
review.reviewText: The Sheraton Four Points in Emeryville is convenient to both Oakland and Berkeley. The service is excellent, with morning coffee provided in-room and in the lobby, and a nice cafe for breakfast; a hot tub and small pool; and a modest exercise room. The hotel is quiet and clean, and across the street from a Starbuck's and a Trader Joe's, and two blocks from a Border's for a paperback to read on the plane going back. Great location; warm and friendly desk staff. Highly recommended!

review.title: Convenient location, Friendly Staff
review.reviewText: This hotel is in an ideal location if one will spend time in Berkeley, Oakland, and San Francisco. It is close to the Freeway so getting to any of these cities is easy. The only drawback is that it has railroad tracks a couple of hundred yards away, and the trains start running early in the morning, so it might be hard to sleep in. Otherwise, I was pleased with the hotel and would stay here again.

review.title: I want to go back.
review.reviewText: With the rate I paid I am extremely satisfied with the hotel service, comfort, and cleanliness.

review.title: Clean quarters, reasonable prices
review.reviewText: My reviews of local hotels choices left me mostly with one of two choices: high prices or fear of cheap, shoddy rooms! The Four Points by Sheraton San Francisco Bay Bridge looked promising with reasonable pricing, decent reviews and nice photos. My stay confirmed my hopes: the lobby staff were friendly and the room was very nice. Ask for a room higher up with a Western view... the Bay Bridge, San Franciso and the Bay itself look great, day or night!

review.title: Business Travel Only
review.reviewText: I stayed here for business one night so I did not get to check in until late (after dinner meeting). Got a 1st floor room right across the banquet room. The workers were up early getting the room set up so it was a bit loud (though I was up early anyhow). One can also hear the train that is very nearby.

review.title: An okay place to stay
review.reviewText: Given there are a cluster of hotels within this area, there are choices. I booked for two nights and asked to extend my stay. Was told conflicting information to my request. They never got it straight. I checked out and found another hotel.

review.title: Quality hotel, convenient location, small room
review.reviewText: While not our first choice of hotels in the Berkeley area, this is a quality, smaller hotel in a convenient location near freeways and shopping. The staff is excellent, providing superior and friendly service. The rooms are nicely appointed and very clean, but small, with the result that there was little space to move around with a kingsize bed. The coffee shop is good, but with limited day-time hours. Not a problem given the many eating and shopping choices nearby.

review.title: Trains and more trains
review.reviewText: The beds are hard and the trains are loud. Good price if you can handle it. Most Sheratons have excellent bedding. This one did not to me. Hotel staff was very nice. Every dood that shuts sounds like it is being slammed. Very loud hotel.

review.title: Good Business Stop
review.reviewText: It was a good choice for a last minute hotel booking for our company. Good location for where we needed to go.

review.title: Very friendly staff
review.reviewText: The staff at this hotel was exceptionally friendly and willing to help with questions, directions, recommendations for the area. Only problem is the air conditioner was extremely loud. Otherwise a great hotel

review.title: Tiny rooms, not soundproof
review.reviewText: The staff was pleasant and responsive enough. There was free wifi in the room, which I appreciated, and there was a computer center in the lobby available to guests, which I did use. HOWEVER: The room was TINY (we could barely squeeze between the dresser and the end of the bed), and it was inadequately soundproofed. We could hear the ice machine right next door quite clearly, and the woman who sat in the hallway having a cell phone conversation in the early morning might as well have been sitting in our bathroom. I finally had to get up and go ask her to go elsewhere so I could sleep. I give it an adequate rating, but I'll go elsewhere next time.

review.title: Perfectly Serviceable
review.reviewText: It was about everything you would expect from a three star hotel. Clean, orderly, without any frills.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: When I made a reservation on Expedia, I spesified a room with two beds, but when I arrived to hotel, at front desk I was told that Expedia reservation choices are not guaranteed and they don't have any rooms with two beds available. Be aware of this issue.

review.title: Good Experience
review.reviewText: Front desk attendants are extremely nice and helpful. We stayed for 3 nights. Over all, we were happy with the experience.

review.title: Taking care of stock holders, not the guests
review.reviewText: -Air conditioner was way too loud -The hotel had no distinguishing character -Way over priced -No tooth brushes or shavers (without asking for them) -Front desk people were understanding and nice -No sound proofing, which made it seem "low rent" -A really silly work out area (not well planned, just an ofter thought) -Bathroom is way too small -Very inconvenient having bathroom sink outside of the bathroom and in the actual living space -All in all, not a bad experience but no where near a favorable one -I really don't know what you thinking, but you're not thinking about the customer as much as your stock holders. I understand that there's a fine line, a delicate balance, but, ultimately, the customer is your life line. You're on the verge of forgetting that fact.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: We stayed overnight, after picking up our parents at the train station, which is very nearby. It was also convenient to restaurants, and a great location near the freeways to get into San Francisco or head elsewhere. Room was comfortable. Food was good.

review.title: Berkeley Visit
review.reviewText: Nice clean hotel. Easy freeway access. Would stay here again.

review.title: Noisy and overpriced
review.reviewText: Beware the 'standard room' as it will be next to an elevator shaft that runs pretty much all night. Many rooms face a busy street or freeway. The quality-to-price ratio at this hotel is not very good.

review.title: Sheraton Four Points
review.reviewText: Hotel was nice and clean. Check out was not until 12:00 Noon which was a very nice surprise. However, the maids started gathering in the hallway around 9:00 AM and were quite noisy. Since it was New Year's morning this was a bit annoying. Overall I would stay there again.

review.title: Great views of the San Francisco Bay
review.reviewText: From the moment we arrived at the Hotel until the day we left the staff were very warm and friendly, even calling us by our names. Housekeeping did a good job each day and we found the rest of the hotel to be clean and tidy. The hotel is situated right in the middle of the bay area and is surrounded by fantastic shops, cinemas and restaurants at Bay Street. Emeryville is not a tourist city like San Francisco, and that was the appeal for us. We did'nt want to be in the middle of all the hustle and bustle, but not to far away so this was an ideal location. You are 10 minutes from San Francisco by BART Train and 10 minutes from either Berkeley or Oakland. Perfect! We even had a Bay view from our 4th floor room (though the freeway was the first thing we saw). Would definately stay there again and would recommend it to friends.

review.title: close to the train station!
review.reviewText: We wish we could have gotten continental breakfast and pick up at train station for the price.

review.title: Love to stay there
review.reviewText: Very good front desk service. The room is clean and convenient. I'm very high recommended.

review.title: very nice place to stay
review.reviewText: This was a good place to stay. The only thing keeping it from "great" is the price, but what can you expect for the area... The bathroom was very small but the beds, pillows, etc. were very comfortable. The location is great! You can walk to the outdoor mall, eat at PF Changs or CPK, trader joes is across the street, etc... The check in and check out was super easy and quick. They even had free apples for you when you check it. Nice touch and heathly!

review.title: Solid
review.reviewText: Front desk staff was very helpful, room was clean and comfortable. Very positive. Location is great too, coffee shops and shopping nearby, Trader Joes. Recommend

review.title: Very convenient
review.reviewText: The location was great for business meetings & connecting with old friends in Berkeley. Only 2 blocks walk to shopping & restaurants. The hotel was very comfortable although the room was a little small.

review.title: four points sheraton
review.reviewText: Nice hotel a little old but nice and clean.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: this hotel would be a great place to stay if you want to visit San Francisco on a budget. It is just off the freeway and very close to the Bay Bridge. We were there to visit family in Berkeley so it was great location for that also. Rooms were a bit small but very clean and the beds were nice. Emeryville sure has changed - movie theater and a really nice little mall area with great shops. Overall a very good value.

review.title: Great, Clean & Close In to Berkeley, Oakland & SF
review.reviewText: I found the Hotel clean and friendly and would not hesitate to refer it to a friend. My only draw back was the size of the room with two queen beds; not enough space.

review.title: great place to stay
review.reviewText: friendly and warm costumer services.

review.title: Would stay again. The continental breakfast was very good!
review.reviewText: I felt this hotel was very clean and in a good location just off a major freeway. However, I felt the price was too high for what services were offered.

review.title: Comfortable Beds!
review.reviewText: This hotel was great! Very comfortable and feather pillows which totally makes a difference for me. I little close to the highway for my liking but I never heard any of the highway noise, it was a great stay and I will stay here again.

review.title: Poor quality
review.reviewText: Room not ready at arrival. Not given room with balcony as offered. Whirlpool not functioning. No clean towels at pool. Unable to open or close bathroom door when person using toilet. Room small. Beds hard. Definately not a 3 star hotel.

review.title: wonderful and affordable
review.reviewText: this was a great hotel... the staff is really friendly and helpful.. there is free internet access... so close the the berkeley campus and really nice looking hotel.

review.title: Great location for San Fran Area
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a great location to travel into San Francisco, Oakland, Napa Valley, etc! It is also close to a nice outside mall (about 2-3 blocks). My only complaint is the road surrounding the hotel - it's all one way streets so you may have to go around the block just to get acorss the street. We had a king bed the week we stayed, but the mattress was bouncy. The smallest movement would wake each other up.

review.title: Nice East Bay Location
review.reviewText: This hotel was very convenient to us staying in Emeryville. Easy access to major freeways. Rooms very nice and clean. Only problem we had was with a few noisy guests in the hallway, but that would have been the only thing negative. Hotel restaurant was not open, but room service was available. Employees were very friendly and helpful. I would stay there again without a second thought!

review.title: I would go back
review.reviewText: I was there six nights and never had any problems. The few times I needed any assistance -- i.e. cabs -- the staff as very helpful

review.title: Bay Area Favorite
review.reviewText: The hotel location is excellent, close to everything in the Bay Area. The restaurant in the hotel is not the best but there are some good choices not too far away.

review.title: Central Location
review.reviewText: This hotel was an excellent choice for nearby shopping in Emeryville and attending a wedding reception on Treasure Island.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Understand this is a city hotel but the room was seriously pokey and the bathroom was made for very little people. We didn't get a king bed so felt squashed in the queen. Also didn't get a room with a Bay view so looked out on nothing special. could have been anywhere, not close by the magnificent SF Bay. This was a choice of pure convenience, and I will not choose to stay here again.

review.title: Decent business hotel
review.reviewText: Overall, this is a good business hotel. The rooms are immaculate, the beds very confortable with free highspeed internet and a nice desk for work. The only complaint is that if you choose a hotel based on the quality of the hotels "business center", ie, printer, fax, etc, pass on this hotel. The business center is a tiny room with a printer, copier, 2 terminals and thats about it. Better bring your USB cord because they dont have any. Fortunately, there's a Kinkos 2 blocks away.

review.title: Small but clean and nice
review.reviewText: Our room was clean and comfortable, the staff was friendly and the location was great with quick access to Berkeley campus and the Bay bridge. The price for all this was more than reasonable compared to similar hotels.

review.title: Will be staying there again this Saturday
review.reviewText: Near Berkeley and the City.

review.title: Good place to stay
review.reviewText: I choose this hotel since all hotels in SF downtown were fully booked. Hotel staff was friendly and went out of thier way to make me feel confortable. Rooms were clean and beds comfortable. Lot of places to eat and shop at walking distance. Buses are easily available for Bart or Downtown SF. Hotel had free parking and cat 5 internet connection in the room. Also had business center where guests can use computer/printer. Good view of bay bridge and Marina from 5th floor and above.

review.title: Nice hotel for price and location
review.reviewText: A fairly small hotel but location is very central and by the bay bridge.  Very easy to get to SF.  Right by a new mall so there are plenty of restaurant choices near by along with shopping in walking distance.  Based on the size of the hotel, the hotel restaurant was not great, but not a big deal.  My room was incorrectly booked with 1 king versus 2 doubles.  Clerk upgraded the room to bay view free of charge.  One other note, bay view rooms are really not worth anything unless above the 4th floor (there is only 7 floors on this hotel).

review.title: good hotel
review.reviewText: great location, easy to get to S.F. only 15 min. away.

review.title: Top-notch!
review.reviewText: Overall I had a terrific experience at the Four Points by Sheraton in Emeryville.  From the moment we checked-in to the time we departed - we all had an extremely comfortable stay.  The room I stayed in was very nice.  I loved the bed! How many of us say that when we are away from our own! The bed was very comfortable and very "pretty!"  It was adorned with lots of big, fluffy, clean pillows.  Very, very clean room!  The staff was also extremely friendly and helpful!  Although this trip was business...I would definately stay there for pleasure!  From the facility to the employees who run it...top-notch!

review.title: Comfortable for business travel
review.reviewText: This certainly isn't a place I'd recommend for leisure travel, but for business travel it is comfortable and clean. The free Internet access is a plus. The location is convenient to San Francisco (just across the Bay Bridge) at a lower price than you'd get there for a hotel (or much better quality at the same price). Food choices nearby are a little limited, but if you're hungry the choices are adequate.
